SMW Subobject for Set up trapImage: File:Deadfall.pngObject ID: 19217Uses infobox: SceneryIs members only: trueIs variant of: Deadfall

A deadfall is a type of trap used in the Hunter skill. The deadfall trapping technique is used to catch several kebbits and maniacal monkeys. With the required Hunter level, a knife and logs in the inventory (or a banana when hunting maniacal monkeys), clicking on a boulder will set the trap. When the kebbit or monkey paths towards the trap, it may be caught.

If the prey is successfully caught, the boulder will fall on the animal, and the player will have the option to "check" the deadfall trap. If not successful, the boulder will fall back to its original position, and the player has to set up the trap again.

Rather than bringing the logs to set deadfall traps, it's advisable that players bring an axe to cut their own logs at the hunting area, with the exception of Kruk's Dungeon, where logs are not used and a Kruk monkey greegree and bananas are needed instead to catch maniacal monkeys.

Adding bait to a trap will increase the catch rate by +3%, while smoking a trap will increase the catch rate by +2%.[1] Due to the low increase of the catch rate, most players believe that smoking or adding bait to traps doesn't justify the extra actions it takes.

Boulders for setting up deadfall traps can also be found south of Weiss in an inaccessible area.

Contents

  • 1 Creatures
  • 2 Multiple traps
  • 3 Locations
  • 4 References

Creatures[edit | edit source]

The following Hunter creatures may be caught using the deadfall trapping technique.

Creature Exp Location
23 Wild kebbit 128 Piscatoris Hunter area
33 Barb-tailed kebbit 168 Feldip Hunter area
37 Prickly kebbit 204 Piscatoris Hunter area
51 Sabre-toothed kebbit 200 Rellekka Hunter area
60 Maniacal monkey 1,000 Kruk's Dungeon

Multiple traps[edit | edit source]

Deadfall trapping can be done with only one trap at a time.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Members Spawns Map
Piscatoris Hunter area (Prickly kebbit)11Maplink
Piscatoris Hunter area (Wild kebbit)9Maplink
Rellekka Hunter area (Sabre-toothed kebbit)10Maplink
South of Weiss9Maplink
Feldip Hills Hunter area (Sabre-toothed kebbit)8Maplink
Kruk's Dungeon (Maniacal monkey)16Maplink

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 2 November 2016. (Archived from the original on 15 August 2019.) Mod Ash: "+2% for the smoke, +3% for the bait."

The deadfall trapping technique is used to catch several [[kebbit]]s and [[Maniacal monkey (Hunter)|maniacal monkey]]s. With the required Hunter level, a [[knife]] and [[logs]] in the inventory (or a [[banana]] when hunting maniacal monkeys), clicking on a boulder will set the trap. When the kebbit or monkey paths towards the trap, it may be caught. If the prey is successfully caught, the boulder will fall on the animal, and the player will have the option to "check" the deadfall trap. If not successful, the boulder will fall back to its original position, and the player has to set up the trap again. Rather than bringing the logs to set deadfall traps, it's advisable that players bring an [[axe]] to cut their own logs at the hunting area, with the exception of [[Kruk's Dungeon]], where logs are not used and a [[Kruk monkey greegree]] and [[banana]]s are needed instead to catch [[Maniacal monkey (Hunter)|maniacal monkeys]].
